result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark William Ihrcke

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark William Ihrcke not in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Mark William Ihrcke.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Mark William Ihrcke appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Mark William Ihrcke.  Prosecuting Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status following 22CF3064. Matter is adjourned to Br. 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark William Ihrcke not in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Mark William Ihrcke.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant has a pending matter regarding case 22CF3064. Defense requested to be appointed on the pending matter, so ordered by the court. Case is adjourned for a status conference in Preliminary hearing court to tag along with the pending matter.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Mark William Ihrcke in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn; both appear by video.  Defendant Mark William Ihrcke in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Milwaukee Officer Zachary Seefeld. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report 8.5.22

Defendant Mark William Ihrcke in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Mark William Ihrcke in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a return on warrant.  Defendant is NOT eligible for SPD appointment.  Court appoints Attorney Lori Kuehn at County Expense.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set cash bail.  Court scheduled a preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch PE.  
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Proposed Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($2,000.00) LW

Bench warrant cleared by Sheriff's Department on 8-2-2022. Case is scheduled for 8-4-2022 for return on warrant/bail hearing in Branch 36. Notice is sent to state and defense. Office of the State Public Defender contacted for appointment of counsel.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Mark William Ihrcke not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The defendant having failed to appear with the conditions of his release, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mark William Ihrcke in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Mark William Ihrcke in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark William Ihrcke appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
